result.execSummary:
The defendant Marcus D Williams was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Marcus D Williams is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Marcus D Williams was found guilty of Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Court finds deft is not eligible for expungement.

miscConds.notes:
Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.  
*  Pay supervision fees.  
Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by your agent, which may include: alcohol/drug, anger management/DV counseling, psychiatric/psychological, AODA Assessment and follow-through with recommended treatment.  Actively search for employment, be employed or attend an educational institution or vocational training program.  
*  Pay fine of $100 and court costs including all applicable surcharges.  
*  Defendant ordered to submit to a DNA sample & pay DNA surcharge and notice was given.  
*  If unpaid financial obligations remain at discharge or revocation, civil judgment to be entered.   
Cooperate with the Child Support Agency to establish paternity and to pay child support and make all court appearances in any paternity action.   May not have contact with Chasity H, unless otherwise permitted by the court/agent.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Marcus D Williams

records.addlTxt: Bond applied; partial refund;    ds/cp    ck#16CH075849
Conditions of Probation Imposed by the Judge

Attorney Margaret Drees appeared for the State.  Def. appeared with Atty Margaret Drees.  Clerk K. Zirbel.  Count 1 - Dismissed on State motion.  Count 2 - Plea of guilty; found guilty by the Court.  Sentenced to serve 21 days in Co. Jail w/Huber; sentence is STAYED, placed on probation for six months w/conditions.  Court finds def. is not eligible for expungement.  Defendant is ordered to submit a DNA sample; written notice provided to defendant.
No disposition. Leave on for next scheduled court activity.  kmk
filed by Atty. James Fields-Bowers  kmk

127pm
  Special Prosecutor Attorney Daniel Tombasco  appeared for the State.  Clerk JThwing. Minutes:  Defendant appeared in court in person.  Def. is referred to the Public Defender.  If not eligible, def. to retain his own counsel. Court date will not be adjourned due to def.'s failure to retain counsel.  Not guilty plea entered by court on behalf of DE.  Defendant requests Jury Trial.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for January 8, 2016 at 01:15 pm.  Final pre-trial scheduled for February 2, 2016 at 08:40 am.  $650  Continued Posted Cash Bond Set w/conditions (see bond entry).   jk
